Column Comment.0: PRODUCTION ENTITY SUBTYPE: the type of production entity may be equal to oneof the table names of the PDEN subtype tables, such as PDEN_WELL,PDEN_COUNTY or PDEN_FIELD. Validated by check constraint.
Column Comment.1: PRODUCTION ENTITY IDENTIFIER: An identifier that is unique within a specificproduction entity source and type.
Column Comment.2: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.3: PRODUCT TYPE: A reference table identifying the type of product (fluid) such asGAS, OIL, WATER, NGL, etc. Includes the less common products like STEAM,METHANE, BUTANE, HELIUM, etc.
Column Comment.4: CASE ID: A model of proposed production for a production entity. A forecast may becomprised of one or more segments and one or more fluids or fluid ratios.
Column Comment.5: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.6: CASE NAME: full or long name given to the case study.
Column Comment.7: DECLINE CURVE TYPE: Tthe type of decline curve that is used in decline curveforecast calculations such as exponential, harmonic, hyperbolic, linear, etc.
Column Comment.8: DECLINE TYPE: The type of decline that is used in decline curve forecastcalculations such as nominal or effective percentatge.
Column Comment.9: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.10: END DATE: End date for this decline segment.
Column Comment.11: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.12: FINAL DECLINE: Final percentage decline value for decline segment.
Column Comment.13: FINAL RATE: Final rate of production for this decline segment.
Column Comment.14: INITIAL DECLINE: Initial percentage decline value for decline segment.
Column Comment.15: INITIAL RATE: Starting rate of production for decline segment.
Column Comment.16: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.17: PROJECT IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a project that has resulted in thecreation of a decline analysis and forecast.
Column Comment.18: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.19: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.20: START DATE: Start date for this decline segment.
Column Comment.21: VOLUME: Total volume for this decline segment.
Column Comment.22: VOLUME OUOM: Volume original units of measure.
Column Comment.23: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.24: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.25: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.26: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.27: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.28: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.29: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
